meanings.sent1: The depute attended the meeting on behalf of the manager.
meanings.sent2: The company's depute handled all the paperwork efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The depute sheepishly admitted to forgetting the important documents.
meanings.sent4: She was the depute of the team, guiding them through the project.
meanings.sent5: The depute's role was crucial in ensuring smooth communication within the department.

meanings.sent1: The manager will depute a new team leader next week.
meanings.sent2: They depute someone to oversee the construction project.
meanings.sent3: I depute you as the official taste tester for the event.
meanings.sent4: The responsibility to depute a spokesperson fell on the CEO.
meanings.sent5: The principal decided to depute the teacher as the head of the science department.

meanings.sent1: The teacher will depute different tasks to each student.
meanings.sent2: It is common for managers to depute specific duties to their team members.
meanings.sent3: The chef deputed the preparation of desserts to the pastry chef.
meanings.sent4: She deputed the responsibility of organizing the event to her assistant.
meanings.sent5: The captain deputed the navigation of the ship to the experienced sailor.
